name: Premier Surgical Network

primary: Women ages 35-70 concerned about breast health or recently diagnosed with breast cancer
Adults of all ages needing general surgery, including hernia and skin procedures
High-risk individuals seeking preventive breast care or BRCA counseling
secondary: Primary care physicians and OB/GYNs who refer surgical cases
Oncologists and imaging centers involved in breast cancer care

brand_mission: Premier Surgical Network is committed to providing expert, compassionate surgical care to patients facing breast disease, hernias, and complex soft tissue conditions. We help patients make informed decisions and support them every step of the way—from diagnosis to recovery.
tagline: Where Patients Come First—Before, During, and After Surgery.

do: Use patient-first language: compassionate, empowering, supportive
Highlight multidisciplinary breast cancer care and accreditation
Mention minimally invasive techniques and personalized treatment plans
donot: Avoid overly technical or jargon-heavy content
Don’t suggest PSN performs imaging (like mammograms)—they are surgical specialists
Avoid comparing surgical success rates unless backed by data
Don’t use terms like 'cheap surgery' or 'quick fix'

clinical_strengths: Specialization in breast cancer, hernia, and soft tissue procedures
Advanced techniques like hidden scar and nipple-sparing mastectomies
In-house access to sentinel lymph node biopsies and oncoplastic surgery
philosophical_strengths: Every patient receives personalized care, not a one-size-fits-all plan
Focus on preserving quality of life and long-term outcomes
Emphasis on shared decision-making and education
Care coordination across referring providers and oncology teams
organizational_strengths: Multiple locations across New Jersey for convenient access
Recognized in NJ Top Doctors listings
Network of experienced providers across hospital affiliations

topic_targeting: Content should be tailored by procedure or condition. Pages about hernias, breast cancer, and cysts should target condition-based search intent. Blogs and secondary pages may focus on procedure education, FAQs, or post-operative expectations.
procedure_language: Use terms like 'lumpectomy,' 'mastectomy,' and 'hernia repair' with clear, patient-friendly explanations
Describe techniques such as 'minimally invasive surgery' or 'oncoplastic reconstruction' when applicable
Balance technical accuracy with empathy and reassurance—avoid intimidating medical terms unless explained
